functions.name: messageBox

params.name: message
params.description: The message to display in the dialog

params.name: title
params.description: The title for the dialog box

returns.description: Void

functions.description: Displays an informational-style message popup box to the user.

functions.name: warningBox

params.name: message
params.description: The warning message to display

params.name: title
params.description: The title for the dialog box

returns.description: Void

functions.description: Displays a message to the user in a warning-style popup dialog.
examples: system.gui.warningBox('Tank level is approaching high limit.')

functions.name: errorBox

params.name: message
params.description: The error message to display

params.name: title
params.description: The title for the dialog box

returns.description: Void

functions.description: Displays an error-style message box to the user.

functions.name: confirm

params.name: message
params.description: The message to display in the confirmation dialog

params.name: title
params.description: The title for the dialog box

params.name: allowCancel
params.description: If True, adds a Cancel button to the dialog in addition to Yes and No

returns.description: True if the user clicked Yes, False if the user clicked No. None if allowCancel is True and the user clicked Cancel

functions.description: Displays a confirmation dialog box to the user with Yes and No buttons.
examples:
if system.gui.confirm('Are you sure you want to delete this record?'):
    system.db.runUpdateQuery('DELETE FROM records WHERE id = %d' % recordId)
result = system.gui.confirm('Save changes before closing?', 'Save', True)

functions.name: inputBox

params.name: message
params.description: The prompt message to display

params.name: defaultText
params.description: The default text pre-filled in the input field

returns.description: The text entered by the user, or None if the dialog was canceled

functions.description: Opens a popup input dialog box that shows a prompt message and allows the user to type in a string.

functions.name: passwordBox

params.name: message
params.description: The prompt message to display

params.name: title
params.description: The title for the dialog box

params.name: echoChar
params.description: The character to display instead of typed characters

returns.description: The password entered by the user, or None if the dialog was canceled

functions.description: Displays a password input dialog that masks the user's input.

functions.name: chooseColor

params.name: initialColor
params.description: The initial color to select in the color chooser dialog

params.name: title
params.description: The title for the dialog box

returns.description: The color selected by the user, or None if the dialog was canceled

functions.description: Prompts the user to pick a color using the default color-chooser dialog box.

functions.name: color

params.name: red
params.description: Red channel (0-255), or a color string like 'red', '#FF0000', or 'RGB(255,0,0)'

params.name: green
params.description: Green channel (0-255). Only used when red is an integer

params.name: blue
params.description: Blue channel (0-255). Only used when red is an integer

params.name: alpha
params.description: Alpha (transparency) channel (0-255)

returns.description: A new Color object

functions.description: Creates a new color object from RGB(A) values or by parsing a color string.
functions.long_description: Can be called with a single string argument (color name like 'red', hex like '#FF0000', or functional like 'RGB(255,0,0)'), or with 3-4 integer arguments for R, G, B, and optional A channels.

functions.name: openDesktop
functions.signature: openDesktop(screen=None, handle=None, title=None, width=None, height=None, x=None, y=None, windows=None)

params.name: screen
params.description: The screen index to open the new desktop on

params.name: handle
params.description: A unique string handle for this desktop

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the new desktop frame

params.name: width
params.description: Width in pixels of the new desktop frame

params.name: height
params.description: Height in pixels of the new desktop frame

params.name: x
params.description: X position of the new desktop frame

params.name: y
params.description: Y position of the new desktop frame

params.name: windows
params.description: List of window paths to open in the new desktop

returns.description: A reference to the new Desktop frame object

functions.description: Creates an additional Desktop in a new frame.
functions.long_description: Opens a new secondary desktop frame for the Vision client. Useful for multi-monitor setups. Each desktop can have its own set of windows. Use the handle parameter to reference the desktop later with system.gui.desktop().

functions.name: closeDesktop

params.name: handle
params.description: The handle of the desktop to close. If omitted, closes the desktop that the script is running in

returns.description: Void

functions.description: Closes an open desktop associated with the current client.

functions.name: desktop

params.name: handle
params.description: The handle of the desktop to get. If omitted, returns the primary desktop

returns.description: An object that allows invoking system.gui functions on the specified desktop

functions.description: Allows you to invoke system.gui functions on a specific desktop.
functions.long_description: Returns a desktop handle that proxies system.gui function calls to the specified desktop. For example, system.gui.desktop('secondary').messageBox('Hello') will show a message on the secondary desktop.

functions.name: getCurrentDesktop

returns.description: The handle of the current desktop, or None if on the primary desktop

functions.description: Returns the handle of the desktop that the current script is running in.

functions.name: getDesktopHandles

returns.description: A list of handles for all secondary desktops currently open

functions.description: Returns a list of all secondary desktop handles currently open in the client.

functions.name: getWindow

params.name: windowPath
params.description: The path of the window to find

returns.description: A reference to the window object

functions.description: Finds a reference to an open window with the given path.
functions.long_description: Returns a reference to the window with the given path. Throws a ValueError if the named window is not currently open. Use system.gui.findWindow() to search without an exception.

functions.name: findWindow

params.name: windowPath
params.description: The path of the window to find

returns.description: A list of matching window references. Empty list if not found

functions.description: Finds and returns a list of windows with the given path.
functions.long_description: Unlike getWindow(), this function does not throw an exception if the window is not found. Returns an empty list instead.

functions.name: getWindowNames

returns.description: A list of all window paths in the current project, sorted alphabetically

functions.description: Returns a list of the paths of all windows in the current project.

functions.name: getOpenedWindows

returns.description: A tuple of references to all currently open windows

functions.description: Finds all of the currently open windows and returns a tuple of references to them.

functions.name: getOpenedWindowNames

returns.description: A tuple of paths of all currently open windows

functions.description: Finds all of the currently open windows, returning a tuple of their paths.

functions.name: getParentWindow

params.name: event
params.description: A component event object from which to find the parent window

returns.description: A reference to the parent window containing the component that fired the event

functions.description: Finds the parent window of a component that fired an event.

functions.name: getSibling

params.name: event
params.description: A component event object

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the sibling component to find

returns.description: A reference to the sibling component

functions.description: Given a component event object, looks up a sibling component.
functions.long_description: Shortcut for event.source.parent.getComponent(name). Useful for referencing other components in the same container from an event handler.

functions.name: getQuality

params.name: component
params.description: The component to check quality for

params.name: propertyName
params.description: The name of the property to check quality for

returns.description: An integer representing the data quality of the property

functions.description: Returns the data quality for the property of the given component.
functions.long_description: Can be used to check the quality of a Tag binding on a component to take alternative actions in the event of device disconnections. Quality value of 192 indicates good quality.

functions.name: transform
functions.signature: transform(component, newX=None, newY=None, newWidth=None, newHeight=None, duration=0, framesPerSecond=24, acceleration=0, callback=None)

params.name: component
params.description: The component to transform

params.name: newX
params.description: New X position for the component

params.name: newY
params.description: New Y position for the component

params.name: newWidth
params.description: New width for the component

params.name: newHeight
params.description: New height for the component

params.name: duration
params.description: Duration of the animation in milliseconds. 0 for instant

params.name: framesPerSecond
params.description: Frames per second for the animation

params.name: acceleration
params.description: Acceleration factor for the animation. 0 for linear, positive for ease-in, negative for ease-out

params.name: callback
params.description: Function to call when the transformation is complete

returns.description: Void

functions.description: Sets a component's position and size at runtime, with optional animation.
functions.long_description: Transforms a component by changing its position and/or size. Can animate the transition by specifying a duration. The callback function is invoked when the animation completes.

functions.name: convertPointToScreen

params.name: x
params.description: X coordinate relative to the component

params.name: y
params.description: Y coordinate relative to the component

params.name: event
params.description: A component event object to determine the source component

returns.description: A tuple of (x, y) coordinates relative to the screen

functions.description: Converts coordinates relative to a component to screen coordinates.

functions.name: createPopupMenu

params.name: itemNames
params.description: A list of strings for the menu item labels

params.name: itemFunctions
params.description: A list of function objects to call when each menu item is clicked

returns.description: A popup menu component that can be shown using its .show() method

functions.description: Creates a popup menu with string entries and function click handlers.
functions.long_description: Creates a new JPopupMenu which can be shown over a component on a mouse event. Each menu item has a label and a corresponding function that is called when the item is selected.

functions.name: getScreenIndex

returns.description: The index of the screen where the client is currently displayed

functions.description: Returns the index of the screen that the client is currently on.

functions.name: setScreenIndex

params.name: index
params.description: The screen index to move the client to

returns.description: Void

functions.description: Moves the client to a specific monitor by screen index.
functions.long_description: Use system.gui.getScreens() to get a list of available monitors and their indices before calling this function.

functions.name: getScreens

returns.description: A dataset containing information about all monitors connected to the computer

functions.description: Returns a list of all monitors on the computer the client is running on.

functions.name: isTouchscreenModeEnabled

returns.description: True if Touch Screen mode is currently enabled in the client

functions.description: Checks whether the running client's Touch Screen mode is enabled.

functions.name: setTouchscreenModeEnabled

params.name: enabled
params.description: True to enable Touch Screen mode, False to disable it

returns.description: Void

functions.description: Enables or disables Touch Screen mode on the running client.

functions.name: showNumericKeypad

params.name: initialValue
params.description: The initial numeric value to display

params.name: fontSize
params.description: The font size for the keypad display

params.name: usePasswordMode
params.description: If True, masks the input like a password field

returns.description: The number entered by the user, or None if canceled

functions.description: Displays a modal on-screen numeric keypad for mouse or touchscreen input.

functions.name: showTouchscreenKeyboard

params.name: initialText
params.description: The initial text to display

params.name: fontSize
params.description: The font size for the keyboard display

params.name: passwordMode
params.description: If True, masks the input like a password field

returns.description: The text entered by the user, or None if canceled

functions.description: Displays a modal on-screen keyboard for mouse or touchscreen text entry.

functions.name: openDiagnostics

returns.description: Void

functions.description: Opens the Client runtime Diagnostics window.
functions.long_description: Opens the Diagnostics window which provides information about performance, logging, active threads, connection status, and the console.
